attributes.action: Reduce Teacher's Pension costs for implementing pension sharing after divorce
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If anyone with a DES Teacher Pension wishes to implement pension sharing with their spouse after divorce, then Capita (a private company who adminsters the civil service scheme) will charge over £900. Most companies charge nothing for this service. 

Capita, with Government and Union blessing are imposing a hefty charge in order to reduce a pension, typically by half. The admin costs are minimal - there is no justification for imposing such a charge. This facility has previously been administered by civil servants, for whom we already pay taxes. 

Unions - supposed to be acting for their member's interests - seem to have voted for this charge without a murmur.
